name: ChapterMaker
tagline: Create and edit video chapter files.
body:
### What is ChapterMaker?
ChapterMaker is a completely free and open source application for the creation and editing of video chapter files as used in Matroska (MKV) files.   It provides a host of features that allow tremendous flexibility in the way that the files are prepared, but the priority during design was to make the functionality simple to use.

[![Download ChapterMaker](https://a.fsdn.com/con/app/sf-download-button)](https://sourceforge.net/projects/chaptermaker/files/latest/download)

### Features
Some of the features of ChapterMaker include:
* Drag 'n' drop loading of chapter times and/or titles
* Variety of time editing tools including scaling and shifting
* Title editing includes a "title case" formatting utility
* Outputs to XML or OGM format chapter files

### Operating Platform
ChapterMaker has been developed for the Windows operating system; however, it has been designed as a portable application.  This means that it can be installed and run from any drive or directory (including a USB stick) and does not use the Windows registry.  Configuration files are stored in the same directory as the program by default.

### Free License
ChapterMaker is provided completely free of charge to everyone.  It is distributed under the GNU [General Public License](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html) as published by the [Free Software Foundation](http://fsf.org/).

### Downloads & Support
The ChapterMaker application is being hosted on [SourceForge](https://sourceforge.net/projects/chaptermaker/) for downloading and support.  Support is available through a [Wiki](https://sourceforge.net/p/chaptermaker/wiki/Home/) as well as a [Discussion Forum](https://sourceforge.net/p/chaptermaker/discussion/).  Tracking and management of [bug reports](https://sourceforge.net/p/chaptermaker/tickets/) and [enhancement requests](https://sourceforge.net/p/chaptermaker/features/) is also being handled on SourceForge.

### Source Code
The source code and development of ChapterMaker is being hosted by [GitHub](https://github.com/rdswift/ChapterMaker).  The ChapterMaker application has been developed using [SharpDevelop](https://sourceforge.net/projects/sharpdevelop/).

### Authors and Contributors
ChapterMaker's author is [Bob Swift](@rdswift).  This project has not had any other contributers yet, although improvement ideas and help are always welcome.
